result.execSummary:
The defendant Boston Jeremy Hubbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: any other sentence.
*03-09-2018 - Defendant is not eligible for CIP and SAP.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- Provide a DNA sample.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- No contact with the 2400  Block of West Wisconsin Avenue, Milwaukee WI, or Rhode M.:
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Boston Jeremy Hubbert

records.addlTxt: *Per order signed on 03-09-2018 JOC amended to reflect that defendant is not eligible for CIP and SAP.
Signed and filed, Decision and Order Denying Request for SAP Eligibility and Order Amendign Judgment of Conviction.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. spc

Defendant's pro se request for SAP eligibility.  

(Return address: Boston J. Hubbert #389697, Dodge Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 700, Waupun, WI  53963).

Per request of court reporter.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 185 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 1/2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 1/2 YEARS.

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 5 YEARS.

Conditions of Extended Supervision / Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education.
- No contact with the 2400  Block of West Wisconsin Avenue, Milwaukee WI, or Rhode M.:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Boston Jeremy Hubbert in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Boston Jeremy Hubbert in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Attempt Robbery (Threat of Force), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), 939.32, a Class E Felony.
No reply from surety/defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
